Alternate five back blows and five abdominal thrusts until the object is expelled or the child becomes unresponsive.   5. If the child loses consciousness, call emergency services immediately (or have someone else call) and begin CPR—check the mouth for the object each time before giving breaths.   6. Even if the object comes out and the child seems fine, seek medical evaluation to ensure no internal injury or airway swelling.
